page.title: 05Changing Times
page.content: In the 1700's Hafod was a great place of beauty. It was full of green fields,flowers, trees and farmyards. {The river water was pure and clean.} In the 19th century the copper industry came to Swansea. This made use of the coal in the Swansea Valley and iron ore from Cornwall and Devon. The copper works were built in 1810 by John Vivian.They became the largest works in the world. With the coming of the copper works, life in Hafod changed. It became ugly, grimy, dusty, smelly, and smoky.{The trees {and grass were killed and the water {was polluted and turned red.} The air was poisoned and many people had chest infections and died before they were 40 years old from the fumes of the copper smelting chimneys.
